name: reabsorb
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to absorb (= take in) a substance again, or to be absorbed again: In less dry times the roots can transfer water to the soil and reabsorb it later when needed. Leaving the steak to sit for a few minutes allows the juices to re-absorb into the meat. Related word
reabsorption
More examplesFewer examplesThe cabbage will reabsorb this salty brine during the fermentation.Blood will stagnate in the muscle tissue and often does not reabsorb back into the system.When trees are cut down, some sub-soils re-absorb moisture and expand, causing structural damage to property.
